item.title: About
item.description: About It’s a blog, with graphics and food. I currently work at Epic Games as a senior programmer. Acknowledgements markdownlint-cli - NPM CLI tool to run markdownlint on Markdown files. proselint - Tooling to verify stylistic aspects of prose. https://github.com/richelbilderbeek - Richel Bilderbeek has crazy amount of resources to help you get bootstrapped with Travis CI. I was able to use his travis_proselint tutorial as a jumpoff point.

item.title: Add comments to Hugo with utterances
item.description: tl;dr Add the utterances GitHub app to your GitHub Pages repo utterances uses GitHub Issues to manage the comments, so it needs authorization Go through the utterances setup to create the script blob that will add comments to your blog posts. Check your theme documentation to determine where you should add your utterances script blob. Regenerate the static site (> hugo), and push the modified post contents.

item.title: Hugo for Natives
item.description: tl;dr Create an empty GitHub Pages repo e.g. robbiesri/robbiesri.github.io to contain the static generated site. Create an empty git repo to hold the backing Hugo infrastructure This can be also hosted on GitHub ðŸ˜ƒ Install Hugo Use Hugo to initialize a new site, pick a theme, and build some content Peep the Hugo Quick Start guide Initialize the GitHub Pages repo as a submodule in the .

item.title: Kickoff
item.description: I figure it’s about time that I try to disseminate some of the information that I’ve hoarded through the years. Selfishly, I’ve found that documenting something forces me truly understand whatever I’m writing about. This weblog is split into two primary topics: Graphics Programming Home Cooking Why these two? Why not? I care about these two things, so why not share some information? Especially in the age of COVID-19 (when this blog was born), these topics intersect more than ever!
